olcme_degerlendirme:
Measurement and evaluation methods should be planned by considering the level of the learning outcome and the content of the topic. To ensure a holistic evaluation of the student, both traditional and complementary (alternative) measurement and evaluation methods should be used together, in accordance with the learning outcome and the topic content.

In measurement and evaluation practices, assessment should not be limited to outcome-oriented evaluation only; measurement activities aimed at process evaluation should also be planned. The evaluations planned throughout the process are important for identifying and addressing possible deficiencies in teaching and learning.

For students who continue their education through inclusion/integration, the Individualized Education Program (IEP) is taken as the basis in measurement and evaluation.

Giving explanations/reasons
 —I think/guess/believe/suppose it is exciting.
—In my opinion/to me, it is lovely.
—In my opinion/to me, it sounds/looks fascinating.

Making comparisons
—In my opinion/to me, historical architecture is more beautiful than modern architecture.
—I think/guess/believe/suppose all-inclusive hotels are more attractive than bed and breakfasts.

Talking about experiences
Have you ever been to …?
—Yes, I have.
—No, I have not.
—I have been to Side before.
—I have never been to Mardin.

Measurement and evaluation methods should be planned by considering the level of the learning outcome and the content of the topic. To ensure a holistic evaluation of the student, both traditional and complementary (alternative) measurement and evaluation methods should be used together, in accordance with the learning outcome and the topic content.

In measurement and evaluation practices, assessment should not be limited to outcome-oriented evaluation only; measurement activities aimed at process evaluation should also be planned. The evaluations planned throughout the process are important for identifying and addressing possible deficiencies in teaching and learning.

For students who continue their education through inclusion/integration, the Individualized Education Program (IEP) is taken as the basis in measurement and evaluation.

Making predictions about the future 
(Giving reasons and results)
—I think we will have water shortage in the 
future because we waste too much water. So we should/must stop wasting water sources.
—I think there will be serious droughts. So schools should educate students to use less water.
Do you think there will be a water shortage?
—Yes. There won’t be enough water.
—No. There will be a lot of rain in the future.
